intro: Zinnia elegans var. alba, commonly known as the white zinnia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its large, showy, white petals that are typically arranged in a radiating pattern around a central disk. The plant is an annual herb that thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for gardeners. Its flowers bloom in late summer to early fall, adding a striking contrast to other colorful blooms in the garden. Zinnia elegans var. alba is also known for its resistance to pests and its ability to attract pollinators like bees and butterflies.
